page.title: 02Family Life
page.content: The average school day for children is to get up between 7am and 8am; have breakfast; go to school; lunch at school or at home; leave for home at 3.50, walking or by car or bus; do homework before or after tea,and play, watch TV or go out; in bed by 10 to 11pm. At weekends they are allowed out till 11 or 12pm. In the holidays some sleep late; others help around the house, and depending on transport and weather, stay in and watch TV, listen to tapes or records or go to town or beach or just play/talk with friends. Some get jobs or have to work for pocket money at home.There is great contrast in children's minds between the happiness of early childhood and difficulties experienced in families when growing up, especially in the teenage years.
